text: opened in the grounds of Matsuyama Castle in Matsuyama, Ehime Prefecture, Japan in 1998, as the successor to the , which opened in 1970. The collection of some 11,900 works includes paintings by Monet and Cezanne, nihonga practitioners Yukihiko Yasuda and Yokoyama Taikan, and yōga masters Nakamura Tsune and Yasui Sōtarō, as well as pieces by local artists, including Sugiura Hisui and . ==See also== * Museum of Ehime History and Culture * List of Cultural Properties of Japan - paintings (Ehime) ==References== ==External links== * The Museum of Art, Ehime Category:Museums in Ehime Prefecture Category:Matsuyama, Ehime Category:Museums established in 1970 Category:1970 establishments in Japan
title: The Museum of Art, Ehime
